Class Attack

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.model.design.statePattern.StateMachine
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.model.adventurecards.cardstates.CardStateMachine
it.polimi.it.galaxytrucker.model.adventurecards.interfaces.attack.Attack
All Implemented Interfaces:
Subject
Direct Known Subclasses:
CombatZone, MeteorSwarm, Pirates
public abstract class Attack extends CardStateMachine
Abstract base class for all adventure cards that involve projectile-based attacks in Galaxy Trucker.

This class manages shared functionality such as targeting, shield activation, firepower management, and projectile direction tracking. It serves as the foundation for concrete attack cards (e.g., CombatZone, Slavestation, etc.), each implementing their own attack() logic.

  • Stores the player being attacked and their current firepower.
  • Tracks all projectiles and their directions.
  • Uses the AimingSystem to determine impact coordinates for each projectile.
  • Handles shield activation and determines whether incoming projectiles can be blocked.
  • Stores the final aimed coordinates of each projectile for use during damage resolution.
Each projectile has:
  • A direction it travels (e.g., from the rear of the ship).
  • An associated target coordinate.
  • An optional shield that can block it, depending on orientation.
The Shields system:
  • Shields are activated using a map of shield coordinates and their battery inputs.
  • After activation, each shield's orientation is stored to check if it can block a projectile.
  • The method isShieldActivated(Direction) checks if any shield is active in the reverse direction of an attack.

Usage

Concrete classes must implement the attack() method, which defines how and when projectiles are resolved.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Stefano Carletto

    • aimAtCoordsWith

      public List<Integer> aimAtCoordsWith(Projectile projectile)
      Determines the coordinates on the player's ship targeted by the given projectile.
      Parameters:
      projectile - the projectile being aimed (e.g., small or big shot)
      Returns:
      the list of two integers representing the aimed row and column

    • activateShields

      public void activateShields(HashMap<List<Integer>,List<Integer>> shieldsAndBatteries)
      Activates the specified shields on the player's ship by consuming battery power, and registers their active orientation for use during projectile defense.

      Each entry in the provided map contains the coordinates of a shield component and a list of battery slots used to power it. After activation, the shield's orientation is stored to determine if it can block incoming projectiles during the attack() phase.

      Parameters:
      shieldsAndBatteries - a map where keys are the coordinates of shield components, and values are lists of battery coordinates used to power them

    • activateNoShield

      public void activateNoShield()
      Indicates that the player chooses not to activate any shields during the current attack phase.

    • isShieldActivated

      public boolean isShieldActivated(Direction direction)
      Checks whether any active shield is oriented to block a projectile coming from the specified direction.

      The method iterates over all active shields and their orientations, and returns true if at least one shield covers the opposite direction of the attack.

      Parameters:
      direction - the direction from which the projectile is coming
      Returns:
      true if a shield is active in that direction, false otherwise

    • attack

      public abstract void attack()
